results.name: Table T(n,k) = max{n,k} read by antidiagonals (n >= 1, k >= 1).
link: Peter Kagey, Antidiagonals n = 1..126 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Flatten[Table[Max[n-k+1, k], {n, 13}, {k, n, 1, -1}]] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Nov 17 2011 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = max(n,k) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 07 2017
(MAGMA) [Max(n-k+1,k): k in [1..n], n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 23 2019
(Sage) [[max(n-k+1,k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 23 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([1..15], n-> List([1..n], k-> Maximum(n-k+1,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 23 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
